description.narrative: IPS aims to contribute to the transformation of Turkish media towards rights-based journalistic values and to become a reliable outlet of independent news with a rights-based, multi-voice approach.Bianet, the news portal of IPS Foundation, has become a model for free and independent news reporting with a rights-based approach. The objectives of IPS can be summarized under three headlines: (I) The Editorial Desk works for enhancing the role of the media and becoming an example of independent news channel acting as an open space for sharing, and producing reliable and non-biased news on human rights. (II) The Freedom of Expression Work monitors and publishes news and reports on the violations, developments and the struggle on Freedom of Expression and Press Freedom. III) The Training and Capacity Building Work provides training programs and resource materials for the promotion of rights-based journalism with an aim to introduce independent and rights focused journalism.

IPS har sedan 2001 varit en oberoende mediaröst i Turkiet. De har ett konsekvent rättighetsperspektiv i sin rapportering som inte styrs av partipolitiska, etniska eller religiösa intressen. De gör heller inte avkall på kvalitén varken när det gäller journalistiska ideal eller språkmässig presentation vilket ger hög trovärdighet. Med publicering på turkiska, kurdiska och engelska når de brett, och de rapporterar också konsekvent från ett Turkiet utanför storstäderna. BIA har också en uttalad ambition att ge plats i det offentliga samtalet till de civilsamhällesorganisationer som arbetar för mänskliga rättigehter, med särskilt fokus på kvinnoorganisationer och organisationer som representerar Turkiets minoriteter. BIAs tre huvudben - redaktion/oberoende nyhetskanal, stärkande av yttrandefriheten och utbildning/kapacitet – är överlappande och beroende av varandra, och aktivitetskombinationen nyhetsrapportering, djupare granskning, och utbildning i rättighetsbaserad journalistik visar också på ambitioner och kapacitet att skapa långsiktig förändring
Support to the IPS Foundation for managing the independent online media outlet Bianet

sector.narrative: Media and free flow of information

tag.narrative: 10.2 - By 2030, empower and promote the social, economic and political inclusion of all, irrespective of age, sex, disability, race, ethnicity, origin, religion or economic or other status.

10.2 - Till 2030 möjliggöra och verka för att alla människors, oavsett ålder, kön, funktionsnedsättning, ras, etnicitet, ursprung, religion eller ekonomisk eller annan ställning, blir inkluderade i det sociala, ekonomiska och politiska livet.
16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.
5.1 - Avskaffa alla former av diskriminering av alla kvinnor och flickor överallt
5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.

description.narrative: bianet continues to act as an independent news platform that provides un-biased news on latest events with special focus on freedom of expression, women rights and environment. Vulnerable people; refuges, LGBTI, women, GBV victims, children, minorities are being given special coverage. Activities and declarations of CSOs also are voiced in the platform. News is produced through a rights based approach and readership and delivering timely news is forsaken for checked and approved news articles. Albeit more modest in size compared to mainstream opposition media outlets bianet is chosen by more informed readers seeking access to qualified news. The platform supplies news in Turkish, and limited amount of articles in Kurdish and English. It serves as an important news platform in a constrained media landscape. bianet was one of the few online sources –in several cases the only one- that consistently follows and covers judicial proceedings of those whose professional and civil rights are violated under statutory decrees. Bia Media Monitoring continues to publish reports that provide the most comprehensive and up to date coverage on killed, imprisoned or attacked journalists as well as sub-sections such as closed/confiscated media organizations; dismissed media workers; social media related arrests; closed/banned websites, internet slowdowns. The reports not only inform the public but also keeps the issue in the agenda. Capacity building activities have yielded to a journalism school that is providing training throughout the year. Workshops held in various cities and summer journalism school was met with high interest and the capacity activities were re-structured and centralized in a fixed seminar/workshop venue under the name BIA Seminars/Atölye BIA (Journalism School). Reporting on freedom of expression, human rights, judicial journalism, peace journalism, environmental journalism, gender-based journalism, multilingual reporting constituted the content of the trainings. More technical issues such as news workshop, photojournalism, visualization tools, internet journalism, digital security for journalists, use of social media tools, ethical reporting was also held as workshops. The school continues to carry out its capacity building activities and enhances the experienced and novice journalists capacity and is met with high interest. bianet is carrying on its activities with a focus on people’s rights to information. It serves as an important media outlet of independent journalism where the standards for ethically and politically responsible journalism is raised. It keeps on serving news with the idea of social benefit in production and distribution of information
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
